course_outcomes.description: Apply algorithmic thinking to understand, define and solve problems.
Interpret the typical programming constructs such as data (primitive and compound), control, modularity, and recursion in a program.
Analyze a given program by tracing, identifying coding errors, and debugging them.
Develop computer programs that implement suitable algorithms for problem scenarios and applications.
Analyze different elements of an AI system
Apply elementary principles of AI for problem solving and search
Apply constraints and logic for intelligent systems
Apply knowledge representation and reasoning for defining intelligent systems
Apply the static equilibrium conditions on a particle and a rigid body in plane and space.
Evaluate the support reactions and the internal forces in structures/trusses.
Compute the properties of areas and bodies of composite sections.
Apply the concepts of frictional forces and forces at contact surfaces of various engineering systems.
Compute the kinematic variables of particles and rigid bodies.
Understand the foundational concepts of the Mahābhārata, an overall idea of its contents, the multifarious lessons and possibilities of the text.
Comprehend insights on various strategic lessons insinuated in the Mahābhārata and possibility of implementing the tactical and political ideas discussed in the epic.
Evaluate the female characterization and an appreciation of regional tales, traditions and the spirit of living in harmony.
Analyze the epic, its contemporary relevance, and application in day-to-day life.
Apply the principles of Newtonian Mechanics to Engineering problems.
Understand the fundamentals of wave optics and its applications in engineering.
Understand the essentials of electromagnetism & electrodynamics and apply them to simple applications.
Identify the functional elements, concepts, and performance of various sensors.
Evaluate the performance characteristics of different types of sensors and transducers for robotic applications.
Perform pre-processing of signals for improving the quality of the sensor.
Analyze the sensor signatures in time domain and extract frequency characteristics.
Select suitable sensors and associated signal-processing methods for applications in robotics and automation.
Comprehending India's contribution to the world in different fields of science and literature.
Understanding the socio-religious aspects of Indian Culture, such as the role of women in India through ages and conceptual aspects of gods.
Understanding the structure of the Vedic literature and knowledge systems.
Analyzing the legacy of selected dynasties in ancient India.
Applying and analyzing the concepts of the Spiritual Heritage of India and understanding their role in our day-to-day life.

Increase student understanding of the true essence of India's cultural and spiritual heritage. Emancipating Indian histories and practices from manipulation, misunderstandings, and other ideological baggage thus, shows its contemporary relevance.
Understand the ethical and political-strategic concepts to induce a critical approach to various theories about India.
Familiarize students with the multidimensional of man's interaction with nature, fellow beings, and society in general.
Appreciate the socio-political and strategic innovations based on Indian knowledge systems. Gives an understanding of bringing Indian teaching into practical life
Apply algorithmic thinking to understand, define and solve problems.
Interpret the typical programming constructs such as data (primitive and compound), control, modularity, and recursion in a program.
Analyze a given program by tracing, identifying coding errors, and debugging them.
Develop computer programs that implement suitable algorithms for problem scenarios and applications.
Apply the introductory concepts and techniques of linear algebra, calculus, complex functions, and probability theory.
Summarize mathematical concepts commonly used in data science and AI.
Apply the combinations of learned mathematical concepts in the form of computational and algebraic methods.
Computationally model electrical and mechanical systems.
Apply the laws of thermodynamics in applications of thermal systems.
Determine the performance of internal combustion engines.
Describe and comprehend the various elements of power transmission systems.
Compute stresses, strains, and deformation of various mechanical components.
Compute bending stress, shear stress in beams and analyze stresses and deformation in circular shafts due to torsion.
Familiarize the basic concepts in electrical circuits.
Comprehend the study on construction and working of various electrical machines.
Illustrate the working of basic electronic circuits.
Develop various logic circuits for real world applications
To gain knowledge about the mechanics of writing and elements of formal correspondence
To understand and summarize technical documents
To apply basic elements of language in formal correspondence
To interpret and analyze information and to organize ideas in a logical and coherent manner
To compose project reports/documents, revise them for language accuracy and make technical presentations
Identify the functional elements, concepts, and performance of various measurement elements, concepts, and performance of different types of sensors and transducers for robotic applications.
Evaluate the performance characteristics of different types of sensors.
Perform pre-processing of signals for improving the quality of the sensor signature.
Analyze the sensor signatures in time domain and extract frequency components.
Select suitable sensors and associated signal-processing methods for applications in robotics and automation.
